method.name: Data Complexity Metrics calculation

reference.ref: T.K. Ho and M. Basu. Complexity measures of supervised classification problems, IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, 24(3) pp. 289-300, 2002.

generalDescription.type: Estimation of the inherent complexity of the data for the classification task
generalDescription.objective: Calculate twelve indicators of the source of complexity for the considered data set
generalDescription.howWork: Twelve measures are computed over the TRAINING data, which provide a hint about the complexity of the data, i.e the problematics that this data set would pose for the classification task. These measures are of three different types: - Measures of overlaps in feature values from different classes: F1, F2, F3 - Measures of separability of classes: L1, L2, N1, N2, N3 - Measures of geometry, topology and density of manifolds: L3, N4, T1, T2
